CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 9, 1953, pg. 29, reads: "SOUTH AMERICAN SCENE - Victor Hereford's Creative Dancers are shown in one of the phases of their famous 'South American Market Scene,' to be presented at Schenley High School on May 25 at 8:15 P.M. Seated, left to right, are Mamie Hamilaton [sic], Juanita Baskin and Yvonne Kershaw. Standing are Carlton Penn, Sandra Pernell, Orval Smith, Yvonne Wright, Billie James, Victor Hill, Carol Ann Christmas, Paul Noll, Alberta Thompson, and little Diane Littlejohn."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Victor Hereford's Creative Dancers in South American costume, including seated: Mamie Hamilton, Juanita Baskin, and Yvonne Kershaw; standing: Carlton Penn, Sandra Pernell, Orval Smith, Yvonne Wright, Billie James holding Dianne Littlejohn, Victor Hill, Carol Ann Christman, Paul Noll, and Alberta Thompson, posed for "South American Market Scene" performance, seen from above
